column5: Finally was able to get some soft water fishing in today... Original plan was to take the little man but he had a change of heart so I dropped off the kids at grandmas and took to wife...  Literally first cast    We proceeded to get into crappies with a few OOS perch and bass mixed in...  Fun couple hours in the sun with no kids around...  Hot baits were the black/green Houdini fry and pink fin s shad
Very nice fish! Way to go.
I was up at lake scugog today and its open. Has anyone been on for Crappie's? not looking for spots just curious if anyone has had any luck..
What a colorful spot Lol  Nice job!
Lol  Yeah  Shore spots that hold fish are few and far between around here... And most are very noticeable to other locals...
Nice going Mike! looks like fun!
Nice job Mike, got out to my local spot, back bays are still ice covered, lol!
Some canals/creeks still have ice here...  The ones that don't are booming with life... Mink... Frogs... Turtles... Minnows... Birds...  Felt a little like summer...  Much needed feeling
Yeah, we ended up just going for an extended boat ride (while dodging iceburgs  )
Sucks your lil man didnt get out, but he did a GREAT job on ms paint lol. Awesome MM and glad ya got bit:)
Ya, so bad about the boy!  But good on ya for putting the wife on a beast like that!!  I laughed when I saw that pic.  Even showed my wife!  Which is a rare OFC experience for her..

Way to go Mike. stopped at a local creek that I always wanted to try for ice out crappie and tossed a microjig and a pencil float and caught a 12" perch after 30 seconds, thought I snagged on something, what a surprise, almost summer like, exactly. Unfortunatly the only fish in that creek. Spent another 1\2 hour, nothing.
If you guys like those colours you should see that spot in the fall lol  Beauty slab Mike!
